ImageFunction.operateAffine

Function/Meaning
Affine transformation arithmetic composition
Type
Method of ImageFunction class
Syntax
operateAffine(dst, src, A, B, C, D, E, F, srcrect=null, cliprect=null, affine, mode=omAlpha, face=dfAlpha, opa=255, type=stNearest, hda=false)
Arguments
dst Specifies the destination Bitmap object.
src Specifies the source Bitmap object.
A A parameter. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.
B B parameter. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.
C C parameter. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.
D D parameter. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.
E E parameter. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.
F F parameter. Interpretation changes depending on the affine argument.
srcrect Specifies the rectangle to be overlaid as a Rect object in pixels (at the source Bitmap's image position).
If unspecified, the entire image is targeted.
cliprect Specifies the clipping rectangle as a Rect object (at the destination Bitmap's image position).
If unspecified, no clipping is performed.
affine Specifies how to handle the following six arguments (parameters A - F).
If true is specified, the six parameters are interpreted as follows:
A : a of the 2D affine transformation matrix
B : b of the 2D affine transformation matrix
C : c of the 2D affine transformation matrix
D : d of the 2D affine transformation matrix
E : tx of the 2D affine transformation matrix
F : ty of the 2D affine transformation matrix

By affine transformation, the source image position (x, y) (where the top-left corner of the source rectangle is (0, 0)) is converted to the destination image position (x', y') by the following formula:
x' = a*x + c*y + tx
y' = b*x + d*y + ty

If false is specified, the six parameters are interpreted as follows:
A : X-coordinate position (x0) of the top-left corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position
B : Y-coordinate position (y0) of the top-left corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position
C : X-coordinate position (x1) of the top-right corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position
D : Y-coordinate position (y1) of the top-right corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position
E : X-coordinate position (x2) of the bottom-left corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position
F : Y-coordinate position (y2) of the bottom-left corner of the source rectangle at the destination image position

If false is specified, the destination position (x3, y3) corresponding to the bottom-right corner of the source is automatically calculated by the following formula:
x3 = x1 - x0 + x2
y3 = y1 - y0 + y2
mode Specifies the arithmetic mode.
omPsNormal: Photoshop-compatible alpha composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsAdditive: Photoshop-compatible linear dodge composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsSubtractive: Photoshop-compatible linear burn composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsMultiplicative: Photoshop-compatible multiplication composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsScreen: Photoshop-compatible screen composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsOverlay: Photoshop-compatible overlay composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsHardLight: Photoshop-compatible hard light composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsSoftLight: Photoshop-compatible soft light composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsColorDodge: Photoshop-compatible color dodge composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsColorDodge5: Color dodge composition compatible with Photoshop version 5.x or lower (not implemented in the current version).
omPsColorBurn: Photoshop-compatible color burn composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsLighten: Photoshop-compatible lighten composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsDarken: Photoshop-compatible darken composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsDifference: Photoshop-compatible difference composition (not implemented in the current version).
omPsDifference5: Difference composition compatible with Photoshop version 5.x or lower (not implemented in the current version).
omPsExclusion
